p: Because their low toxicity to mammals [ 7] and high biodegradability, essential oils (EOs) of aromatic plants are regarded as very promising substances for the formulation of low-toxic, eco-friendly pest control products [ 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13]. However, despite their efficacy and low toxicity, EOs application in practice is still limited because of their high volatility, composition variability, and strong smell. In fact, EOs olfactory traits may interfere with the sensory characteristics of the treated foodstuff, resulting in products that are not appealing to the consumers [ 14].
